text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse generates roughly US$2.5 billion in annual revenue.
text_1_evidence: “…it is still a small company, generating only 2,5bn USD in revenue”
text_2_claim_summary: Reported consolidated net sales were US$2.513 billion in FY-2022 and US$2.363 billion in FY-2023.

text_1_claim_summary: Sales are geographically balanced at ~38 % Americas, ~38 % Asia-Pacific, ~24 % Europe (shipped-to basis).
text_1_evidence: “…38% of sales in North America, 38% of sales Asia Pacific … and 24% Europe”
text_2_claim_summary: FY-2023 shipped-to sales were 38 % Americas, 38 % Asia-Pacific, 24 % Europe.
text_2_evidence: “Americas $ 901.5 m, Asia-Pacific $ 898.9 m, Europe $ 562.3 m out of $ 2,362.7 m total”

text_1_claim_summary: No single customer represents more than 10 % of Littelfuse’s revenue, implying very low customer concentration.
text_1_evidence: “…no customer represents more than 10% of sales and I would assume the customer base to be extremely fragmented”
text_2_claim_summary: Arrow Electronics accounted for 11.2 % of consolidated net sales in 2023 (and >10 % in 2022 and 2021).
text_2_evidence: “Sales to Arrow Electronics, Inc. … were 11.2 %, 11.5 % and 10.7 % of consolidated net sales in 2023, 2022, and 2021, respectively”

text_1_claim_summary: Littelfuse serves more than 100,000 end customers, indicating a broad, fragmented demand base.
text_1_evidence: “… sells its products to >100,000 end customers”
text_2_claim_summary: Company states it serves over 100,000 end customers across its end-markets.
text_2_evidence: “Serving over 100,000 end customers, our products are found in a variety of industrial, transportation and electronics end markets”

text_1_claim_summary: Management’s 2021-25 strategic plan targets 5-7 % average annual organic growth and 5-7 % from acquisitions.
text_1_evidence: “investor day … aiming for double-digit revenue growth, in turn composed of: 5-7% organic growth; 5-7% growth from acquisitions”
text_2_claim_summary: 10-K confirms current five-year plan targets 5-7 % average annual organic growth plus 5-7 % from strategic acquisitions.
text_2_evidence: “The Company is targeting average annual organic sales growth of 5-7 percent and average annual sales growth from strategic acquisitions of 5-7 percent.”

text_1_claim_summary: Recent acquisitions have been funded mainly with internal cash generation, keeping leverage low and share count flat.
text_1_evidence: “…acquired … financed by internal cash generation and debt levels have barely budged. Over the same period, share count has not changed either.”
text_2_claim_summary: 10-K notes recent deals (Western Automation, Embed, Hartland) were funded with cash on hand; C&K used cash plus debt; Dortmund fab down-payment funded with cash.
text_2_evidence: “…Western Automation… approximately $162 million in cash… financed … with cash on hand.”
“C&K Switches… $540 million in cash… financed … through a combination of cash on hand and debt.”
